tidbits.title: Unique Biodiversity
tidbits.description: Christmas Island is known for its unique biodiversity, including the annual red crab migration, diverse marine life, and endemic species like the Abbott's booby bird.

tidbits.title: Natural Wonders
tidbits.description: The island features natural wonders such as the stunning Dales and Hugh's Waterfalls, expansive rainforests, and pristine beaches with diverse coral reefs.

tidbits.title: Phosphate Mining History
tidbits.description: Phosphate mining has historically shaped the island's economy and landscape, with remnants of mining infrastructure contributing to its unique character.
